reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was very nice and we had a wonderful view. We stayed at the hotel for three nights. It was very close to the train station. Our balcony looked out to one of the many waterfalls in the valley. It was a very peaceful and relaxing stay. We look forward to returning to this great hotel.
reviews.title: Great time at a beautiful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a brief 4 day visit to the Jungfrau area. We wanted to see as much as we could so decided to stay in Lauterbrunnen that way we could tackle Murren, Gimmelwald, and Schilthorn one day; returning to our hotel in Lauterbrunnen then Wengen, Jungfrau another day, and Grindelwald yet another. The Silberhorn was perfectly located about 1/2 block from the train station in Lauterbrunnen. We ended up getting a room that had an extra living/TV room (we had not expected). We also had a garden area outside with a table. The bathroom had a shower and a bathtub! The breakfast (came with the cost of the room) was superb with eggs and sausage as well as the regular fruits, breads, cereals and expresso/kaffe machine. It was the best experience we have had in a long time and we travel quite a bit. The people were extremely warm and welcoming. I highly recommend this hotel. Be sure you do not confuse this with the Silberhorn Hotel in Wengen (Best Western). We arrived there (Wengen) only to find out that it was the wrong Silberhorn!
reviews.title: Best experience in a long time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our hotel en route during our trip, being as it wasn't quite high season yet, and we were completely pleased with this hotel! They put us on the 3rd floor (no lift), perhaps since we appeared able to make the trip, and we had a fabulous corner room with balcony and views of the waterfall, the valley and the cogwheel train that chugged up and down to Wengen and the Jungfrau regularly throughout the day. Very nice accommodations, terrific staff, perfectly clean and welcoming. They even put out breakfast for us in the lobby at 6:30 AM so we could eat before catching the first train to the top of the Jungfrau, which was very kind. Their regular breakfast is awesome, which we got to experience the other 2 days. We would stay there again, no doubt. As far as dinner, we preferred the dinner at the Hotel Oberland, a short walk up the street, but dinner was good here as well.
reviews.title: A nice stay

reviews.text: I stayed 3 nights here, but there was so much to do in the area I left early morning and returned late evening every day. I ate in the restaurant for breakfasts, which were in the cost of the hotel room, and one lunch, and the food was great. I had a great room with a great view. The bed was softer than at the other hotels I stayed at in Switzerland, which was good. The room was modern and clean, as was the hotel. The people were very friendly.
reviews.title: don't stay here if you are single woman, they treat you with disrepect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here 2 nights in July: wished it had been longer. For the same (high) price as hotels in other Swiss cities, this one was extraordinary: large (by European hotel standards) comfortable bedroom, huge bathroom, AND a nice sitting room with couch, TV etc. Balcony overlooking the valley with the Eiger,Jungfrau etc mountains visible. We were in an end unit, right next to the cable car operation (keep that bathroom shade drawn!), but never heard a thing from the bedroom. It's also across from, and visible from, the train station: 3 minute walk. Staff was extremely helpful, friendly (e.g. advice about which mountain peak might be clear, which walks to take); breakfast buffet outstanding. We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant: also very good. It's hard to talk about "value" in Switzerland, since everything is so expensive to begin with, but this hotel was the best value we found. You can stay more cheaply in this town, but not better, I'd say.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.title: great views

reviews.text: We especially liked this hotel because it is a block up from the main street, and is quieter, more private, and pastoral than many of the other hotels right on the main road going through town. We had rooms 26 and 27 in the main building, both with balconies and to-die-for views of the valley and Staubach falls. The corner room also had a view across the valley of hillside farms and Wengen high up on the valley wall. (There are some rooms in side buildings which might not have similar views and ambiance). The hotel is close to the train station (a steep walk up) and close to the cable station to Grutschalp. (The cable car is totally silent as it goes up and down). The hotel has a nice combination of rustic style and comfort, very friendly helpful staff, free computer/internet use, a nice garden, and clean, well appointed rooms. Breakfast was very good and comprehensive in a beautiful room. The dining room has glass walls with fantastic views. The restaurant is one of the better and more expensive restaurants in a town not known for great restaurants overall. The fish dishes and salads were very good, but we’ve had much better rosti elsewhere in Switzerland. The rosti, as in other LB restaurants, seemed greasy, salty and not crisp. The Veal Zurich seemed to have an artificial taste of bullion, and not the best we’ve had elsewhere. We ate in the restaurant one night to enjoy the food and more elegant ambiance, but chose to eat elsewhere at reduced prices on other nights.
reviews.title: We're Glad we Chose the Silberhorn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were glad we chose Lauterbrunnen as a base, as it is central for lifts to hikes and sights on both sides of the valley. There was also plenty to do, e.g., extended walking in the valley, when the higher elevations (Wengen, Murren, and Jungfrau) were fogged in.
reviews.title: not the best hospitality in Lauterbrunnen
thanks again
reviews.text: Rick Steves says this hotel manages to feel family run despite its size. So not true. A feeling of warmth and genuine hospitality is exactly what is missing at this hotel. I chose here after having enjoyed my previous stays in other hotels in the area, mainly because I wanted my wife, who was having her first visit to the vally, to experience the best on offer. This was a mistake. she was taken aback at the cold reception during check in and never felt truly comfortable (they told us that the room was not ready although it was past check in time at 3:00 pm. we were not offered an explanation or an apology. instead, we were told flat out to come back later. when I asked when 'later' was, the receptionist simply shrugged!!). We ended up not even having one dinner at the hotel restaurant, against our previous plans. We will not return.
